items.title: DuckDuckGo is amping up its AI search tool — but will still let you leave it behind
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- DuckDuckGo's AI-generated answers now source information from across the web.
- AI chatbot will integrate web search and allow users to control response frequency.
- Features support for multiple AI models and enhancements like uploading images and voice interaction are planned.
- DuckDuckGo emphasizes user privacy, storing data locally and not using it for AI training.
- The service will remain free, with potential premium features in future subscription plans.

items.title: Our first look at Apple’s sky blue MacBook Air
items.author: Antonio G. Di Benedetto
items.summary:
- The new M4 MacBook Air features a sky blue color replacing space gray, alongside existing colors like starlight, silver, and midnight.
- The M4 model has a 10-core CPU and 8-core GPU, with a 12-megapixel Center Stage webcam designed to track the user.
- Two external monitor support is now included.
- Pricing: 13-inch model starts at $999, and 15-inch model starts at $1,199, marking a return to previous pricing levels for the 13-inch model.
- Available for order next week; hands-on experience and photos have been shared.

items.title: Handheld PC Gaming Revolution: Updates on Steam Deck, ROG Ally, and More
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Valve’s Steam Deck has dominated the handheld gaming PC market three years after its launch, significantly outperforming competitors.
- The Asus ROG Ally X is reviewed as the best Windows gaming handheld available.
- Recent models like the Lenovo Legion Go have been positioned as multi-functional handheld devices.
- Market data suggests that Steam Deck sales surpass those of all competitors combined, emphasizing its market leadership in handheld gaming devices.
- Continuous advancements in technology and design are noted in recent handheld releases, contributing to the evolution of portable gaming.

items.title: 12 Chinese hackers charged with US Treasury breach — and much, much more
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- The DOJ announced charges against 12 Chinese nationals for cybercrimes including hacks of over 100 US organizations since 2013.
- The accused include officials from China’s Ministry of Public Security and employees of a hacking company called i-Soon.
- A group called APT27, or Silk Typhoon, has also been implicated in targeting IT systems and various US organizations.
- The hackers allegedly profited from their activities, with i-Soon charging between $10,000 and $75,000 for each compromised email inbox.
- None of the defendants are currently in custody, and the US government is offering rewards totaling up to $10 million for information on their whereabouts.

items.title: Reddit will warn users who repeatedly upvote banned content
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Reddit will begin warning users who upvote banned content repeatedly within a certain timeframe, starting with violent content.
- Most users will not be impacted, as they already downvote or report abusive content.
- Concerns about users becoming paranoid about voting are noted, but Reddit aims to monitor and address this issue.
- Previous experiments suggested that similar warnings helped reduce exposure to bad content in quarantined communities, prompting a sitewide rollout of this feature.

items.title: This Google change is breaking some digital photo frames
items.author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy
items.summary:
- Google is modifying access to Google Photos APIs, affecting digital photo frames' auto-sync features.
- Aura will disable Google Photos auto-sync on March 17, 2025, requiring manual photo additions thereafter.
- Changes impact user privacy by limiting app access to photo libraries, introducing the Google Photos Picker API.

items.title: The Trump administration wants to review all prospective citizens’ social media accounts
items.author: Gaby Del Valle
items.summary:
- The Trump administration may require social media accounts from applicants for green cards, citizenship, asylum, and refugee status.
- This policy was proposed by USCIS as essential for thorough vetting per President Trump's executive order regarding national security.
- The public can comment on the proposal until May 5, affecting over 3.5 million people applying for immigration benefits.
- Advocacy groups criticize the policy as a form of authoritarianism and surveillance targeting immigrants.
- This new requirement surpasses the State Department’s earlier policy mandating five years of social media history for visa applicants.

items.title: Here are the best Kindle deals right now
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- Amazon's new entry-level Kindle starts at $109.99 featuring a brighter display and improved contrast.
- The Kindle Kids edition comes with accessories and age-appropriate content for $129.99.
- The Kindle Paperwhite offers a larger display and better performance starting at $159.99, with ad-free options available.
- Kindle Paperwhite Kids also available for $179.99, includes parental controls and kid-friendly content.
- New Kindle Scribe expands functionality to writing and note-taking in addition to reading.

items.title: Senate votes to strip the CFPB of its power to regulate X
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- The Senate voted to remove the CFPB's ability to monitor digital platforms like X.
- The resolution aims to overturn a CFPB rule set last year for overseeing digital payment services.
- Senators Elizabeth Warren and Adam Schiff have requested an ethics probe into Elon Musk's potential conflicts of interest related to his ownership of X and his government work.

items.title: Trump’s first 100 days: all the news affecting the tech industry
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- The Trump administration ended an air monitoring program that saved millions in medical costs.
- Trump's proposed tariffs could increase car prices by up to $12,000, leading to a potential crisis in dealerships.
- The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau dropped a lawsuit against Zelle, allowing banks to escape accountability for fraud.
- TSMC plans a $100 billion investment in US chipmaking, starting two new facilities in Arizona.
- The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration cut hundreds of jobs, jeopardizing weather forecasting capabilities.

items.title: AI-generated review summaries are coming to Apple’s app store
items.author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy
items.summary:
- Apple is introducing AI-generated review summaries to the App Store with iOS 18.4.
- Summaries compile highlights from user reviews into short paragraphs, focusing on both positive and negative feedback.
- The feature will initially be available in the US for apps with sufficient reviews in English and will expand to other languages and countries later in 2023.

items.title: Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 7 rumors point to an all-screen cover
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Samsung's Galaxy Z Flip 7 may feature an all-screen cover design, resembling Motorola Razr Plus.
- New renders suggest edge-to-edge cover screen with camera holes; revealed by leaker OnLeaks.
- Inner display expected to grow to 6.8 inches; device to have 12 GB RAM and storage options of 256GB or 512GB, starting at $1,099.

items.title: Bose’s noise-canceling QC Ultra Earbuds are on sale for their best price to date
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- The Bose QuietComfort Ultra Earbuds are discounted by $80, now priced at $219 until March 31.
- Available from retailers including [Amazon](https://www.amazon.com/Bose-QuietComfort-Cancelling-World-Class-Cancellation/dp/B0CD2FSRDD?tag=theverge02-20), [Best Buy](https://howl.link/hxp0khzug3pbr), [Walmart](https://goto.walmart.com/c/482924/565706/9383?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.walmart.com%2Fip%2FBose-QuietComfort-Ultra-Wireless-Earbuds-Noise-Cancelling-Bluetooth-Headphones-Black%2F2655908227%2F), and [Bose](https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/8836598/type/dlg/https://www.bose.com/p/earbuds/bose-quietcomfort-ultra-earbuds/QCUE-HEADPHONEIN.html).
- Features include advanced noise cancellation, improved audio quality for calls, and new silicone wing designs for comfort. Supports aptX Adaptive Bluetooth codec for compatible Android devices.

items.title: Utah becomes the first state to pass an app store age verification bill
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- Utah is the first state to pass the App Store Accountability Act requiring app stores to verify users’ ages.
- The bill mandates parental consent for minors to download apps, as part of safety measures for children online.
- Meta, Snap, and X supported the bill and called for similar action from Congress, emphasizing the need for a centralized age verification system.
- Critics, including the Chamber of Progress, warn that such requirements might infringe on privacy rights and freedom of speech under the First Amendment.

items.title: Tweetbot’s developers are making a Bluesky client
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Tapbots is developing an iOS and Mac app for Bluesky called [Phoenix](https://tapbots.com/phoenix/), set to release this summer.
- They plan to open a limited public alpha as soon as possible.
- Tapbots will continue to develop both Ivory (Mastodon) and Phoenix (Bluesky) concurrently to support their split customer base.
- They will implement a way to cross-post between Mastodon and Bluesky but keep the platforms separate for a better user experience.
- Users can follow the [Phoenix account on Bluesky](https://bsky.app/profile/phoenix.tapbots.com) while awaiting the app's release.

items.title: The hunt for the next Twitter: all the news about alternative social media platforms
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Elon Musk took over Twitter (now X) over two years ago, prompting platforms like Threads, Mastodon, and Bluesky to emerge as alternatives.
- Threads has grown to 275 million monthly users (as of October 2024), integrating features for ActivityPub to connect with the fediverse.
- Bluesky, using AT Protocol, rose to popularity post-2024 elections, boasting over 14.5 million users, while Mastodon struggles to grow.
- No clear successor to Twitter exists as X still functions as a primary platform for many users.
- New features in Bluesky include a 'followers only' reply option and a video tab to make posts easier to find.

items.title: Apple Expands AI Features with iOS 18, macOS Sequoia and More
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- iOS 18.2 introduces Apple's AI starter kit and ChatGPT integration.
- New features include homepage customization and RCS support.
- Siri receives a major upgrade with ChatGPT capabilities.
- iOS 18.4 beta adds Matter support for robot vacuums.
- Apple is preparing to launch new AI features in China in collaboration with Alibaba.

items.title: Here’s how to preorder Apple’s new MacBook Air and Mac Studio
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- Apple announced preorders for the M4-powered MacBook Air and Mac Studio.
- The 13-inch MacBook Air starts at $999 with the M4 chip; the 15-inch model begins at $1,199.
- Mac Studio is available with M4 Max starting at $1,999 and M3 Ultra starting at $3,999.
- Both MacBook Air models support two external displays and have upgraded webcams.
- The M4 Max Mac Studio is up to 3.5x faster than the original model, with enhanced RAM capabilities.
- Preorders are available at Apple, Best Buy, and B&H Photo, with various configurations and upgrades possible.

items.title: US tariffs: how Trump’s tax is hitting Big Tech and beyond
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- President Trump imposes tariffs on imports from Mexico, Canada, and China, affecting various industries including automotive and technology.
- Automakers anticipate a significant impact from the new tariffs, particularly as many vehicles are assembled using parts from these countries.
- CEOs from Best Buy and Target warn consumers of imminent price increases due to the tariffs, particularly affecting produce and electronics.
- Big Tech companies have been largely silent about the implications of these tariffs despite their potential impact on supply chains and costs.
- There has been an overall concern about how these tariffs will influence prices in retail and consumer goods in the coming days.

items.title: Big Tech is now slightly less silent on Trump’s tariffs
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- President Trump's tariffs on imports from Mexico, Canada, and China are currently in effect, affecting Big Tech companies.
- Most major tech companies have remained largely silent on the implications of these tariffs.
- Walmart, Best Buy, and Target have publicly acknowledged potential price increases due to tariffs.
- Gigabyte and Acer have indicated that their prices will also rise, while other companies, including Google and Microsoft, have not commented.
- Some companies like Amazon, Apple, and Samsung continue to remain silent regarding the tariffs.
- The Trump administration has announced a temporary exemption for automotive tariffs on Canada and Mexico, with potential changes to tariffs expected soon.

items.title: Car prices expected to increase by as much as $12,000 thanks to Trump’s tariffs
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- Car prices could rise by up to $12,000 due to President Trump's tariffs if they remain in place.
- Tariffs include 25% on imports from Canada and Mexico and 10% on goods from China.
- Around 5.3 million vehicles are built in Canada and Mexico, mainly for the U.S. market.
- Automakers warn of a historic decrease in production, potentially affecting a third of output in North America.
- The average price of new vehicles in the U.S. could increase from $49,800 to $52,500, over a 7% rise.
- Many popular models may see significant price hikes, with effects not felt for several months due to existing inventory.
- Analysts predict cost increases due to tariffs could range from $4,000 to $12,000 per vehicle, impacting pricing strategies for manufacturers.

items.title: Kia's EV9 will soon be able to power your home
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Kia EV9 owners can access the SUV’s Vehicle to Home power capabilities with a new charger available in June.
- The Wallbox Quasar 2 is the first home EV charger in the US compatible with the EV9 and is available for preorder.
- The Quasar 2 enables power to be drawn from or fed to the EV9’s battery to power homes during blackouts.
- Owners need a 200-amp service at home and may require utility company approval for full functionality.
- The charger supports solar power integration, allowing for energy flow management between solar panels, the car battery, and the grid.

items.title: All the news about EV charging in the US
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- The electric vehicle charging landscape in North America is evolving, with Tesla's North American Charging Standard (NACS) gaining acceptance.
- Numerous automakers, including Ford, GM, and Toyota, are adopting the NACS in their future models, with rollout expected by 2026.
- Tesla plans to install Superchargers at Steak ‘n Shake locations, starting with agreements for over six sites and potentially expanding to 100.
- The US government has allocated $7.5 billion to improve EV infrastructure and reliability for charging networks.
- Kia will gain Tesla Supercharger access in March 2025, using CCS to NACS adapters, with new Ioniq 5 models already equipped with NACS ports.

items.title: The Volkswagen ID. EVERY1 is an affordable EV for the masses
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- Volkswagen unveils the ID. EVERY1, an affordable EV priced at €20,000 ($20,800 USD), aimed at boosting its business.
- Production is set for 2027, with a focus on the European market, amidst competition from affordable Chinese EVs.
- The ID. EVERY1 features a 94 horsepower motor, a top speed of 81mph, and an estimated range of 155 miles (250km).

items.title: The Last of Us: all the news about the video game franchise turned TV series
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- HBO's The Last of Us season 2 has an official premiere date in 2025.
- Neil Druckmann indicated that there might not be a third installment of The Last of Us, stating that fans should not expect more.
- There's a new teaser trailer that highlights the challenges Joel and Ellie will face in the upcoming season.
- The second season will be shorter than the first, potentially covering the sequel across multiple seasons due to its extensive story material.
- The remaster of The Last of Us Part II features enhanced graphics and gameplay elements, attracting new and returning players.

items.title: Amazon Prime Video is getting into the wrestling business with new AEW deal
items.author: Chris Welch
items.summary:
- All Elite Wrestling (AEW) and Amazon's Prime Video announced a multi-year deal for AEW's pay-per-view events in the US, Canada, and the UK.
- The partnership begins with AEW Revolution airing on Sunday, with events priced individually (e.g., Revolution costs $49.99).
- This deal marks AEW's shift from its previous association with Warner Bros. Discovery, which continues to simulcast AEW's weekly shows on their Max service.

items.title: Netflix's Live Push Continues with John Mulaney's Late-Night Talk Show
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary: - Netflix will debut Everybody's Live with John Mulaney on March 12th, airing every Wednesday at 10PM ET. - The show will feature celebrity guests and run live for 12 weeks. - This series is Netflix's second regular live show, alongside WWE’s Monday Night Raw. - Netflix aims to enhance its live streaming capabilities following previous mixed experiences with live events. - The company is exploring further live content opportunities, including live episodes of Hot Ones.

items.title: Google is adding more AI Overviews and a new ‘AI Mode’ to Search
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- Google is expanding AI Overviews to more queries and even to users logged out of Google.
- AI Mode is a new feature that will introduce a search-centric chatbot experience for Google One AI Premium users.
- Users can switch to AI Mode to get AI-generated answers along with links based on Google's search index.
- The Gemini 2.0 model will enhance AI Overviews for complex queries in areas like math and coding.
- Google emphasizes that AI tools are designed to drive users to websites, not detract from them, aiming to create a better context for users before they click through.

items.title: Delta Airlines bets on ‘blended-wing’ flight to reduce emissions
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- Delta Airlines is supporting startup [JetZero](https://www.jetzero.aero/) to develop blended-wing-body (BWB) aircraft aimed at reducing fuel consumption and emissions.
- JetZero will join Delta’s Sustainable Skies Lab for operational support and aims to test a BWB demonstrator aircraft by 2027.
- The BWB design could cut emissions by up to 50% while maintaining current engine technology, and can carry up to 250 passengers.
- Delta has pledged over $1 billion toward sustainability initiatives, targeting carbon neutrality by 2050.
- JetZero has secured a $235 million grant from the US Air Force in 2023 for developing a full-scale demonstrator aircraft.
- Challenges include designing safe evacuation processes and accommodating theater-style seating in emergencies.

items.title: Nintendo wins piracy lawsuit against file-sharing site
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Nintendo has successfully won its legal case against Dstorage for hosting pirated games on 1fichier.com.
- A French court found 1fichier.com liable for not removing unauthorized Nintendo games despite warnings.
- Dstorage was previously ordered to pay Nintendo $1.13 million for not acting on piracy complaints.
- This ruling is viewed as significant for the entire gaming industry, limiting sharehosters’ claims regarding the necessity of court orders to remove copyrighted content.
- Nintendo's legal actions have increased, including cases against the Yuzu and Ryujinx emulators for copyright infringement.

items.title: YouTube brings its more affordable ‘Premium Lite’ subscription to the US
items.author: Chris Welch
items.summary:
- YouTube is launching a new Premium Lite subscription plan in the US, priced at $7.99/month, which is cheaper than the regular YouTube Premium at $13.99/month.
- The Premium Lite plan offers ad-free access to most videos, except for ad-free music, which remains exclusive to the standard Premium plan.
- YouTube intends to expand Premium Lite to other pilot countries, including Thailand, Germany, and Australia, and will roll it out to more countries later this year.
- The idea behind Premium Lite has been tested in various markets since 2021, with ongoing adjustments to subscription offerings.

items.title: Why I love the Logitech MX Vertical wireless mouse
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
- The Logitech MX Vertical mouse was purchased in March 2022 after using an Anker model for 3.5 years.
- Features include wired/wireless use, long battery life, customizable buttons, and reduced wrist pain.
- Downsides: attracts dust and skin residue, limited color options, no left-handed version available.
- Highly recommended for individuals needing ergonomic solutions for wrist health.

items.title: Dyson’s high-tech hairdryer for professionals will soon be available to everyone
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Dyson’s upgraded Supersonic r hairdryer will be available to consumers starting tomorrow in the US and in April for Europe.
- It will be sold at $569.99, the same price as the original, with new color options: ceramic pink and jasper plum.
- The Supersonic r is 30% smaller and 20% lighter than the original and features a new motor design for better weight distribution and even heat production.

items.title: Apple announces MacBook Air with M4 chip and a price cut
items.author: Antonio G. Di Benedetto
items.summary:
- Apple introduces the new MacBook Air models featuring the M4 processor.
- New sky blue color option added; 13-inch model starts at $999 and 15-inch at $1,199.
- Available for order now with a launch date set for March 12.
- Both models support two external displays and come with a 12-megapixel Center Stage webcam.
- Entry-level features include M4 chip with 10-core CPU, 8-core GPU, 16GB memory, and 256GB storage.
- Price drop noted as significant against increasing tariffs.

items.title: Apple launches new Mac Studios with M4 Max and M3 Ultra chips
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Apple introduces new Mac Studios featuring M4 Max and M3 Ultra chips, available for preorder at $1,999 and $3,999, respectively.
- M4 Max model claims to be up to 3.5x faster than the original M1 Max with 14-16 core CPU and up to 40 core GPU; starting RAM is 36GB, with a maximum of 128GB.
- M3 Ultra model features 32 cores, with up to 80 core GPU, starting RAM of 96GB, and support for up to 512GB, with storage options up to 16TB.
- Both models include Thunderbolt 5 connections, with varied USB-C support across configurations.
- Models showcase new graphics features including dynamic caching and a second-generation ray-tracing engine.

items.title: I wore a one-horsepower exoskeleton to the world’s biggest tech show
items.author: Sean Hollister
items.summary:
- The author used the **Hypershell Pro X**, a lightweight exoskeleton, at **CES 2025** to navigate the expansive conference.  
- The device operates in **hyper mode**, allowing longer strides with less fatigue and approximately a **30% reduction** in exertion.  
- The exoskeleton has a **5.3-pound weight** and includes a battery that can limit seating options.  
- The **battery life** allows for up to **13.5 miles** of gentle assistance.  
- Other models at CES, such as **Arc'teryx and Skip Robotics’ MO/GO pants**, provide different designs and features but with some downsides in movement flexibility.

items.title: AMD Radeon RX 9070 / 9070 XT review: Nvidia gets some big next-gen competition
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- AMD launches Radeon RX 9070 ($549) and RX 9070 XT ($599), providing strong mid-range competition against Nvidia.
- RX 9070 surpasses Nvidia's RTX 5070 by 17% in 4K performance; RX 9070 XT matches RTX 5070 Ti at $150 less.
- AMD has 16GB of VRAM on both models, advantageous for 4K gaming compared to RTX 5070's 12GB.
- New RDNA 4 architecture offers improvements in rasterization and ray-tracing performance with FSR 4 upscaling technology.
- RX 9070 series boasts lower power consumption than previous generations and rivals Nvidia's offerings, maintaining cooler temperatures.

items.title: This little AI phone has some wild ideas
items.author: Allison Johnson
items.summary:
- Newnal AI is developing a phone that creates a personal AI avatar from user data.
- The phone captures data from multiple sources including social media, medical, and financial records.
- It encrypts the data and stores it across third-party cloud servers.
- The device uses the AI avatar for tasks like shopping and completing online forms.
- Newnal plans to launch the phone globally on May 1, 2025, with a price of $375.

items.title: Hyundai teams up with Yandex spinoff Avride to develop robotaxis
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- Hyundai partners with Avride to develop driverless cars for ridehailing.
- Avride to deploy 100 Hyundai Ioniq 5 SUVs retrofitted with autonomous technology this year.
- Ioniq 5 vehicles will be assembled at Hyundai's factory in Georgia and integrated with Avride's tech.
- Vehicles to arrive in Dallas later this year as part of a deal with Uber for exclusive deployment on their app.
- Avride also plans to explore other projects including delivery robots and smart mobility applications.

items.title: The questions ChatGPT shouldn’t answer
items.author: Elizabeth Lopatto
items.summary:
- OpenAI's ChatGPT released an ethics framework that has been criticized for its simplistic approach to complex moral questions.
- The model spec implies a reliance on singular answers, ignoring the nuanced nature of ethical inquiry and decision-making.
- Challenges arise in answering ethical dilemmas such as the trolley problem, highlighting the varied philosophical perspectives that exist.

items.title: Latest Turing Award winners again warn of AI dangers
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Andrew Barto and Richard Sutton received the Turing Award for foundational AI training techniques.
- They expressed concern over profit-driven AI development practices by companies.
- Barto emphasized the importance of safety testing before releasing AI products to consumers.
- Reinforcement learning, the method they developed, is a cornerstone in modern AI advancements.
- A warning from top AI researchers highlighted the need for prioritizing AI safety to prevent potential risks.

items.title: Digg is coming back, thanks to its founder — and Reddit’s
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- Kevin Rose, the founder of Digg, is relaunching the platform with a new team, including Reddit cofounder Alexis Ohanian.
- Digg aims to create a community-first social platform, emphasizing user engagement and AI to assist content moderation.
- The relaunch includes a prototype with a homepage and sub-communities, focusing on building excitement and evolving with user input.

items.title: Volvo’s ES90 is a high-riding electric sedan with 434 miles of range
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
• Volvo announced the ES90 electric sedan featuring a range of 434 miles.
• It includes a dual setup of Nvidia’s Drive AGX Orin computer and an 800-volt architecture for fast charging.
• The sedan is available in three variants, with power outputs ranging from 329 hp to 670 hp.
• The ES90 can gain 186 miles of range in just 10 minutes of charging and can fully charge from 10 to 80 percent in 20 minutes.
• It boasts a zero to 60 mph time of 3.9 seconds for the Performance trim.
• The vehicle is designed to blur the lines between a sedan and SUV, featuring a height of 60.9 inches.
• The ES90 has significant cargo space, advanced infotainment systems from Google, and utilizes Volvo's new Superset tech stack.
• Starting orders for the ES90 are available in Europe; pricing and US availability are yet to be announced.

items.title: Cadillac’s new electric Escalade IQL will be the longest SUV in production
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- The Escalade IQL will be the longest SUV ever produced, surpassing the gas-powered Escalade ESV.
- Overall length of the IQL is 228.5 inches, offering more luggage and legroom for third-row passengers.
- It provides 24.2 cu.ft. of cargo space behind the third row and 75.4 cu.ft. with it folded.
- IQL offers 4 inches of additional legroom and 1 inch of headroom compared to the standard model.
- It features a 205kWh battery with a range of 460 miles, capable of gaining 116 miles in just 10 minutes of fast charging.
- Production starts in mid-2025 at GM’s Factory Zero in Detroit.

items.title: Daredevil: Born Again is a rough reboot with a promising future
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- The new series **Daredevil: Born Again** tries to recapture the gritty essence of its Netflix predecessor.
- Features Matt Murdock’s internal struggle between his superhero and civilian lives, especially after a devastating personal loss.
- The show has undergone significant retooling during production, shifting from courtroom drama to a more action-oriented approach.
- Critics note that while it attempts to bridge old narratives, it feels disjointed and struggles to find its identity.
- Original cast members like Foggy Nelson and Karen Page make brief appearances, introducing new characters like Kirsten McDuffie and a new personal therapist.
- The performance of Charlie Cox and Vincent D'Onofrio receive praise, adding depth to their characters’ complex dynamics.
- Despite its flaws, anticipation grows for a potentially stronger second season due to improvements made towards the end of the first season.

items.title: CES 2025: all the news, gadgets, and surprises
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- CES 2025 features significant product reveals and innovations.
- New smart glasses introduce a new era of wearable tech.
- Panasonic showcases advancements in OLED TV technology, achieving up to 4,000 nits brightness.
- Nvidia announces the next-gen RTX 5090 and RTX 5080 GPUs, along with a personal AI supercomputer named Digits.
- Lenovo reveals a rollable laptop priced at $3,500, along with improvements in their handheld gaming devices.
- The Honda Zero lineup includes compelling electric vehicles with new designs and features.
- The Titan Dragon Edition gaming laptop by MSI debuts at the event.

items.title: The best smartwatches for Android
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
- The Android smartwatch market has seen significant growth and variety in recent years.
- Wear OS 5 has been introduced for devices like Samsung’s Galaxy Watches and Google’s Pixel Watch 3.
- Key considerations when choosing an Android smartwatch include processor capability, ecosystem compatibility, battery life, and charging speed.
- Samsung Galaxy Watch 6 Classic is highly recommended for Samsung users, featuring improved battery life and a sleek design.
- The Galaxy Watch Ultra is ideal for outdoor enthusiasts, boasting superior battery life and durability features.
- For non-Samsung users, the Google Pixel Watch 3 offers a refined experience with better integration with Google services and health tracking features.

items.title: Here are the best AirPods deals you can get right now
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- Discounts available on Apple’s AirPods lineup, including AirPods Max and AirPods 4.
- AirPods 4 priced at $117 and $169 (with ANC).
- Latest AirPods Pro with USB-C priced at $199 with improved features.
- AirPods Max available for $500 with USB-C support and new features.
- Various retailers offering discounts on multiple AirPods models.
- Significant upgrades in sound quality, comfort, and features for the new models.
- Discounts are already seen shortly after their release.

items.title: CFPB lets banks off the hook and drops Zelle lawsuit
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) dismissed a lawsuit against Early Warning Services and three banks regarding Zelle.
- The lawsuit claimed that these organizations failed to protect users from fraud, leading to a loss of $870 million since Zelle launched in 2017.
- The dismissal means the CFPB cannot bring these claims again, eliminating chances for consumer relief funds.
- Statements from Zelle and the banks expressed approval of the ruling.

items.title: Nvidia’s GeForce RTX 5070 Founders Edition cards won’t launch until later this month
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Nvidia’s GeForce RTX 5070 Founders Edition to launch later in March.
- Competing models from companies like Asus and MSI available from March 5th.
